Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Given the POWL model: Activities: R Receive Claim, A Assign Adjuster, E Evaluate Claim, P Approve Claim, N Notify Customer, C Close Claim. loop = Operator.LOOP children E P meaning execute E then either exit or P then E again repeatedly. XOR children N skip. StrictPartialOrder nodes R A loop xor C with edges R->A, A->loop, loop->xor, A->C.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Loop semantics: do E, then optionally P and repeat to E. Pattern: E (P E)* so at least one E, number of E = number of P +1. Unusual vs ideal single E then P.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Partial order: linear extensions must respect edges. R before A before loop before xor. A before C. No loop before C or xor before C so possible R A C loop xor meaning C before loop before any E P. Also possible loop C xor meaning C before xor notification.

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: Check if C between loop and xor allowed: yes since loop before xor but C can be inserted after loop before xor as partial order permits. Also C before loop possible. No enforcement of C last.

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Anomalies: 1. Loop allows multiple evaluations approvals cycles. 2. XOR allows skipping N. 3. Partial order enables premature C before loop E P or before xor N.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Anomalies due to: changes in business rules partially implemented, miscommunication between departments, technical errors in workflow, inadequate constraints in process modeler tool.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Loop: business need for rework iterative approval or modeling error intended sequence. Skip N: legitimate optional for some claims or bug. Premature C: missing order constraints or system bug allowing early close.

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Verify with database: queries for claims closed without E or P, multiple P, no N, E after P, first C before first E or first N.

Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Design SQL: CTE for ordered events min timestamps counts. Queries like claims with COUNT P >1, no N, min C < min E, exists E after some P via self join.

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Propose specific PostgreSQL queries using CTEs GROUP BY HAVING for anomalies like closed without evaluation approval, multiple approvals, skipped notifications, closing before evaluation.
